content.question: <math alttext="the sum, from n equals 1, to infinity, of, the fraction with numerator e to the n power, and denominator pi to the n power, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><munderover><mrow><mo>∑</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover></mrow></mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math> is

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator pi, and denominator pi minus e, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>π</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>e</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator e, and denominator pi minus e, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>π</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>e</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator e, and denominator pi, times the natural log of, the fraction with numerator pi, and denominator e" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>π</mi><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mfrac></mrow></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator e, and denominator pi minus e, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>π</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>e</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
